rules.name: Respiratory Infection
rules.advice: You may have a respiratory infection like a cold or flu. Rest, stay hydrated, and monitor your symptoms.
rules.recommendedAction: Home care with rest and fluids. Consider over-the-counter medications for symptom relief.

rules.name: Severe Respiratory Illness
rules.description: High fever with multiple respiratory symptoms
rules.advice: High fever with breathing difficulties requires medical attention. This could indicate a serious respiratory infection.
rules.recommendedAction: Seek medical attention within 24 hours. Consider visiting urgent care or emergency room if symptoms worsen.

rules.name: Cardiac Emergency
rules.advice: Chest pain can be a sign of a heart attack or other serious cardiac condition. Seek immediate emergency care.
rules.recommendedAction: Call emergency services immediately or go to the nearest emergency room.

rules.name: Severe Headache
rules.advice: Severe headache with confusion may indicate a serious neurological condition. Seek immediate medical attention.
rules.recommendedAction: Go to emergency room immediately. This combination of symptoms requires urgent evaluation.

rules.name: Mild Digestive Issues
rules.advice: You may have mild digestive issues. Try eating bland foods, staying hydrated, and avoiding spicy or fatty foods.
rules.recommendedAction: Home care with dietary modifications. Consider over-the-counter antacids if needed.

rules.name: Severe Abdominal Pain
rules.advice: Severe abdominal pain with vomiting may indicate appendicitis, gallbladder issues, or other serious conditions.
rules.recommendedAction: Seek medical attention within 4-6 hours. Do not eat or drink until evaluated by a healthcare provider.

rules.name: Joint Pain and Inflammation
rules.advice: Multiple joint symptoms may indicate arthritis or other inflammatory conditions. Rest, ice, and anti-inflammatory medications may help.
rules.recommendedAction: Schedule appointment with primary care physician within 1-2 weeks. Consider physical therapy evaluation.

rules.name: Allergic Skin Reaction
rules.description: Skin rash with possible allergic reaction
rules.advice: You may be experiencing an allergic reaction. Avoid known allergens and consider antihistamines.
rules.recommendedAction: Monitor symptoms closely. If rash spreads or breathing becomes difficult, seek immediate care.

rules.name: Vision Problems
rules.advice: Vision changes can indicate various eye conditions or neurological issues. Schedule an eye examination.
rules.recommendedAction: Schedule appointment with eye care professional within 1 week.

rules.name: General Fatigue
rules.advice: Persistent fatigue and weakness may indicate various conditions. Ensure adequate rest, nutrition, and hydration.
rules.recommendedAction: Monitor symptoms for 1 week. If no improvement, schedule appointment with primary care physician.

low.description: Monitor symptoms and consider home care

emergency.timeframe: Go to emergency room or call emergency services
